S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: amelri, auwa ta mena’uwa za valruvalruran.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: amelri, piyalralrang na sinsi kaninta mukuwa mena’uwa za valruvalrulren.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: amelri, piyalralrang na sinsi kaninta mukuwa mena’uwa za valruvalrur.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, auwa ta i ’uma semalema za kulang?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: auwa ta penapitawa za dare’ harem kana wari.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: valriiviiyan a valruvalruran i kaziyu a.
tatena’ ku za mau ku ziya mena’u za vaaw za valruvalruran harem.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: valriiviiyan a ’alrivangvang i kaziyu a.
kiya kana vulay, sahar ku za ’alrivangvang.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: valriiviiyan a ’alrivangvang i kaziyu a.
amelri a ’alrivangvang izu, a walru i izu.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: na’una’u i kani, amanan mukuwa kana kaadawilran maw!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: ai, ’azi mi auwa kana kaadawilran.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: amanan pavekas! patawar kemakawang munu kuretapelra’ mu.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: maranger ku dikadika mena’u.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: kemuda u mukuwa i talraviyaw?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: kemuda u mukuwa i sizir?
mipalizing ku mukuwa i talraviyaw.
mipalizing ku mukuwa i sizir.
kemuda mukuwa i biyoing i intaw?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: kemakawang mukuwa i biyoing i intaw.
kemuda u mukuwa i Penghu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: muitras ku za hikuki mukuwa i Penghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: kemuda u mukuwa i Penghu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: muitras ku za sudang mukuwa i Penghu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: muitras u za eman muruma’?
muitras ku za ciē-yun muruma’.
muitras za eman mukuwa i takesiyan i Panay?
S.TRANSL: How does Panay go to school?

S.FORM: muitras za kisiya mukuwa i takesiyan i Panay.
S.TRANSL: Panay goes to school by train.

S.FORM: muitras za eman mukuwa i kiyukay i Kacaw?
S.TRANSL: How does Kacaw go to church?

S.FORM: mizidēnsiya mukuwa i kiyukay i Kacaw.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: muitras u za ciē-yun mukuwa i takesiyan?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: amelri, muitras ku za bas mukuwa i takesiyan.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: mizidēnsiya u mukuwa i takesiyan?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: ai, mizidēnsiya ku mukuwa i takesiyan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: muitras u za kaw-tiē mukuwa i Takaw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ai, muitras ku za kaw-tiē mukuwa i Takaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: muitras u za kisiya nu ’azi mu za hikuki mukuwa i Valangaw?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: muitras ku za hikuki, maradika na hikuki kana kisiya nu muitras ta.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: muitras u za bas nu ’azi mu mipalizing u mukuwa i kiyukay?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: mipalizing ku mukuwa i kiyukay, marakalre’ayan nu mipalizing ta kana muitras za bas.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: adalrep a caw-se i kanmu?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: ’azi kaadalrepan, miotobay ku nu mukuwa ku kana caw-se.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: adalrep na yuvingkiyok kana takesiyan?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: adalrep, kemakawang ta mu, raredek ta.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: adalrep na aekaekanan kana siyataw?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: mupatraran ta kemay kana siyataw zi kemakawang ta za lruwatra pung mu, raredek ta.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: miwari u harem?
kemuda ziyamaw?
maranger ku mukuwa muzangiya kaninu.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: ulra ku vangavangan harem, uniyan ku i ruma’. nu aidan lra mu.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, kaulra nu wari nu ’emanan? kay ku muzangiya kaninu nu piya kare’alri.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: ai, ngangara ku i ruma’ kaninu.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: kiumalra ku ziya, karuwa ku pasirep kana lrengaw? maranger ku venilin zanu vinavatiyan.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: ai mu! kuwatreng za eman?
karuwa ta pasirep semasing?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: amelri nu pana’uwan ku za trau, ’azi inepetr na puwalumayan zi, amanan!
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: ’inava nu semasing ku nu kemazu.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: amanan semasing!
lrayuwan za muwai u kikiumalr kaninku.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: kakuda ziymaw, maranger u kiumalr za eman?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: kiumalra ku ziya, a eman nu kiyakarunan a lralrak u ziya?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: a kinsas ku a pakangaway, mawmu, meretra’ ku lra harem.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, ulra ziya nu kiyakarunan harem?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: kiyakarun ku i takesiyan.
kiumalra ku ziya, kaazu i zekalr nannu alrak?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ’azi, kaazu i tokay nanku alrak.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, kazu u sasa?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: temavur ku ziya za saya za suwan zi za saya za ’ayam, ninku niruma’enan nazu.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: temavur ku za saya za ngiyaw inku, nu milralrang ta za haramhaman mu, ulra ta kivangavangan.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: maranger ku kiumalr kaninu za tu palisiyan pa’alrupan.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: ’azi sazu ku kinalrazaman, mawmu, kunu tuvangaw zaku kinalrazaman ziya.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: ulra a eman palalisiyan kananmu kiyakarukarunan za pa’alrupan?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: ’azi padikes kana vavayan zaniyam kiyakarukarunan za pa’alrupan.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, karuwa mukasa mukuwa pa’alrupa na vavayan?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: ’azi, ’azi karuwa pa’alrup na vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Asaw, uniyan lra za biciw i ruma’, uwa trima’ za biciw inu.
S.TRANSL: Asaw，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Asaw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: ulra ziya a saya dalilr i sawka, amanan ta ziya tremima’.
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧。
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: ’azi karuwa na saya dalilr, uwa ziya trima’ za zuwaya dalilr!
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來！
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za biciw maniwan mu?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: ulra, tratrima’ u za manueman?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za zuwaya dalilr, zi tratrima’ ku ziya za saya luvuk za veras.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: antri na veras a, tratrima’ u ziya za eman?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku ziya za trinun, ulra mu trinun?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: piya mi lra meniwan kana trinun.
tratrima’ ku za kiping.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku za kavang.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: maranger u tremima’ kana kemuda?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku kana kiping na lriketri tu ’aselr.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: tratrima’ ku kana kavang na lriketri tu ’aselr.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: kemuda ini na zemiyar?
ulra ziya a zuma tu pinivalrayan?
ulra ziya a vulretri’ zi a trangiya tu pinivalrayan.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: verayay ku za saya za trangiya na kiping!
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服！
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: verayay ku za saya za trangiya na kavang.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Asaw mukuwa u i iyan a haremay? mukuwa u merenarenaza?
S.TRANSL: Asaw你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Asaw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ’azi, mukuwa ku puwalranga kani imu na vavayan tremima’ za kulang.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: kemazu awlra, miwari u nu karauv? wawai u kurekasa kaninku keravi?
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯？
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: ’azi ku karuwa, auwa ku tremima’a za kiping.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: ’azi ku karuwa, auwa ku tremima’a za kavang.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: kurelranga ku lra kaninu nu kemazu.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: ’inavayan, kiumalra ku ziya pidaya paisu ini na savetu’ na kulang?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: savetu’ makavetra’an na kulang.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: pidaya paisu ini na vurasi?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: satingting makatelun na vurasi.
verayay ku za zuwaya vetu’ za kulang zi za saya tingting za vurasi.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Asaw, malalup ku murung za impis, karuwa u pavulas kaninku?
S.TRANSL: Asaw，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Asaw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: ’azi ku murung inku, nintaw ni Panay ini a.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Panay’s.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, karuwa u pavulas kaninku za dika? kadika ku pareveliyas kaninu.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: ai, niya!
lrayuwan, lrayuwan kuwayu lra i Panay.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Panay for me.

S.FORM: maranger kemakuda?
parevelaliyas ku kanini na zuwaya ’etiv na valray.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: ai, maranger u ziya eman?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: kiyavulas ku ziya kanini na teluwa ’etiv na valray.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: karuwa lra, ikalalup pareveliyas nu meredek kana teluwa wariyan.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: ’azi u ziya pareveliyas kananku aitrul.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: ku pareveliyasaw lra a daman.
kemuda zi uniyan ku aitrul nu kemazu?
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: nu pavulasanay kani Asaw kema ku.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Asaw?

S.FORM: ’azi ku malrazam, ku kiumalray ziya i intaw.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: kunu pavulasay ziya nanku aitrul.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Panay, ini na pakatras na kiping mu, tu ipavulas ni Asaw kaninu?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did Asaw lend you this coat?

S.FORM: amelri, tu trinima’ ni inani kaninku.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: mararesan kaninu tu pakatras na kiping ni Asaw.
S.TRANSL: Asaw’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: a ’uze’uzem tu pakatras na kiping i intaw, ’azi maresan naniyam pinivalrayan.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Panay, kivulas u za paisu kani Asaw?
S.TRANSL: Panay, did you borrow money from Asaw?

S.FORM: ai, parevelaliyas ku kanintaw harem kema ku mu, malalup ku murung za paisu.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, parevelaliyas u nu aidan?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: parevelaliyas ku kanintaw nu ’emanan.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: ai, puwalranga ku lra kaninu pakalrazam kani Asaw.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Asaw for you.

S.FORM: na ’avutar mu, ta petriray kana tutak, na tikuras mu, ta petriray kana sawail, pamau nu kemani.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: kemani awlra, pamelri ku. mau na kemazu zi ’azi ku karasa.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: kunuwa panadamaw lra za kemudakuda ta demaway kanini na zuwaya petrir.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: ai mu! ka’invayan awa! nu kemazu mu, karaasa ku lra na kaidaidan.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: naven lra na tralun i ’uma, uwa i puwalumayan elak za kawkaw, kay ta i ’uma.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: niretra’ i iyan na kawkaw?
ulra i ngidiran kana punun, nana’u u nu musavak u i puwalumayan.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: taranapaw nu maelak u, amanan mavuli’, idangan na kawkaw.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: idadupa’i nanku petrir!
ulra i iyan nanu petrir?
ulra i makalusu kaniziyu na kawi nanku petrir.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: kemuda zi malrazam u?
ulra ku pinuzung i kani a, malrazam ku za ulra i iyan nanku petrir.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: a vuevu ini a, niyam retra’anay i zinanuman ’emevang za vulraw.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: uniyan za vuevu naniyam zekalr, mipangasip mi ’emevang za vulraw.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: ’azi ku ziya atalram mipangasip, panadamaw ku lra nu masalr?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: ai mu! marelranga ta lra mukuwa pangasipa nu masalr.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: nu kemazu mu, kunuwa panadamaw demaway za vuevu.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: matriyakatruk lra nanu pangasip, kamau na ulra a vulraw mupangasip. pakunamun kezengu.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: nu haremay lra, muiyuiyuz na sudang, kazu ku i kani kemezeng kana pangasip, uwa i kaziyu elakanay ku za savang.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: kezengu na vulraw pukuwani kaninku. kunu puwalrangay kemezeng.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: ka’inavayan awa. sazu ta ’inevang harem kana wari, matemuy lra na kara’is.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: kadikaya ta muruma’, ta pu’atraray nanta wadiyan.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: zuwa lra i sinsi.
amanan muzangizangi lra, kunamun kemayan.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: irayan! puwari ku lra!
kunamun musavak.
a pida Liyusan harem?
a Liyusan Lima harem, a Kasede’an nu ’emanan, kay ta muzangiya!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: ai mu! kay ta i zinanuman.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: a pida Liyusan nu ’emanan?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: a Liyusan Telu nu ’emanan, kay ta mamaliya nu piya kare’alri nu ’emanan!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: kakuda u nu ’emanamanan nu ’emanan?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: a Kasede’an nu ’emanan, salrangan ku kani inani auwa i kiyokay.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: kemuda u?
maranger ku muta’, auwa ku i tavuniyan.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: malingatr ku.
miyakupu talaulep ziya.
sinsi, nana ku tiyalr, auwa ku i tavuniyan.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: ai mu, kunamun uwa.
karuwa ku mukuwa murasa ku lima?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: uri puwaludus ta lra, uwa lra nu haremay.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi, nana ku tranguru’, kiyami ku semede’ nu piya kare’alri.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: ai, taranapaw muvuruk.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: sinsi, kiyami ku za sasede’an nu masalr kana liyusan sa, auwa ku pana’uwa kana ising.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: ai, tarana’uwi nu zazek.
ulra i iyan i Sunay?
nana tu tiyalr, ulra i tavuniyan i intaw.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: ulra i iyan i Kasang?
sinsi, nana tu tukeraw i Kasang, semede’ harem.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kasang has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: man ’azi zuwa i Sunay?
zemelretr i intaw.
halra pakalrazamaw mi ziya kannu.
i Munay Sawawan ku, a pulu’ ku ’ami harem.
S.TRANSL: My name is Munay Sawawan, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: i eman nu ngadan?
i Munay Sawawan ku.
a alrak u kana eman ’alrayan?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: a alrak ku kana Pinuyumayan.
a Yēncumin mu saruma’enan mapiya?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ai, a Pinuyumayan mi saruma’enan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是卑南族人。
Yes, my whole family is Pinuyumayan.

S.FORM: a Yēncumin mu saruma’enan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: amelri, a Pinuyumayan i amalri, a Payrang i inani.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是卑南族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Pinuyumayan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: a alrak u ni eman?
a alrak ku ni Wunzay Sawawan.
i temama i iziyu? pidaya tu ’ami lra?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: enem pulu’ tu ’ami lra.
i temama i iziyu? pidaya tu ’ami lra?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: amelri, a dawdawan i intaw kana naniyam zekalr, walu pulu’ tu ’ami lra.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pidaya tu ’ami ni vau lra?
pulu’ walu ’ami lra i ivalri.
kama’izang kannu za ’ami i vau?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: maredawilr mi za lruwatra ’ami.
manueman nu tihasaran?
a sa leman pat pulu’ hamayan ku.
sawariyan ’azi ta maretrevung maratihasar u lra, ai?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: ai, a sa leman telu pulu’ hamayan ku lra.
marasemver u lra ai?
’azi, semiya’ u mena’u.
maravarivariw u lra ai?
’azi, marasemver ku lra.
marasemver u lra?
ai, telu pulu’ kungcin ku lra harem.
auwa u i iyan?
auwa ku i kavalrayan miya’a kani sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: auwa i iyan i Munay?
auwa ’ematelra za rimekan.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: ulra i iyan i Munay?
ulra kana lralranguyan, ’a’ari’ari za lranguy nu haremay i intaw.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: ulra i iyan i Sunay? ’a’ari’ari za melihis i intaw nu haremay.
S.TRANSL: Sunay在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Sunay? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: ulra i pawazuwazukan i intaw, kay ku vinayaw.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: salrangan ta mukuwa i renarenazan.
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: kay ku ziya tremima’a za kare’alriyan, miya’ ku lra kannu nu haremay.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: salrangan ta mukuwa merasa za tavu!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: uwa iya’a za zuma na trau, auwa ku miya’a kani sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: ’a’ari’ari za cuēciyo harem kana wari i Munay?
S.TRANSL: Is Munay competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: ’azi, ’a’ari’ari za nekun atras i intaw.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: ’a’ari’ari u nu azu kana wari nu ’a’ari’ariyan?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ai, ’a’ari’ari ku za melihis.
’a’ari’ari u nu azu kana wari nu ’a’ari’ariyan?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: ’a’ari’ari ku za cuēciyo.
kakuda ta nu azu kana wari nu ’a’ari’ariyan?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: ’a’ari’ari mi za kemezeng za tilu’.
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: naniwan ta za aekanan nu ’a’ari’ariyan?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: ’azi, naniwan ta za kēkuy.
muelak u za pukangaway, tena’ u kana kerevat!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: lrayuwan.
ulra i ruma’ i temu na vavayan?
ulra, ulra alrupe’ i kiya’ezengan i intaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: ulra i ruma’ i temu na vavayan?
uniyan, mau ziya mupatraran a haremay. raruma’ lra nu karauv.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: ulra i ruma’ i temu na ma’inayan?
ulra i pukazuwa tazar i intaw. uwa iya’u kantaw.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: ulra a trau i ruma’?
i Munay a! sawariyan lra ’azi ku mena’u kannu. ’inava u?
S.TRANSL: 是Munay啊，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Munay. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: ’inava! zuwa ku kimazayazayar kannu.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: ulra i temama i iyan?
ulra i sawka maringring za kulang i intaw. kay ku vinayaw.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: ulra i Sunay i iyan?
mukuwa i intaw i puwaterukukan ’emevanga za terukuk.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: imu, zuwa mi lra.
uniyan i temu i ruma’. ulra i ’uma. ngangarayu i inmu i ruma’ kanintaw.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: zuwa u lra, ama!
sawariyan ta lra ’azi maretrevung, maratihasar u lra.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: salaw mi semangal mena’u kannu za zuwa u.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: a re’a i ini na vaveray kanmu. asezu i lralritekan.
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: kemani sawariyan ’azi u zuwa. ku vinayaw mapiya alamu mukasa ta mekana.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: amanan venangavang lra. ’a’awu ku kana kurisepa. kay ta i pakayanan marezayazayara.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: lrayuwan za nu demaulr. vavuruk ku lra.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: mapiya tremuwak ku kanini na terukuk. urungi muruma’ mekan.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: paretrevung ta nu ’emanan nu piyakare’alri, ai?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: ai, paretrevung ta i iyan?
paretrevung ta i takesiyan, ai? sasirep semasasing mi.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: kay ta palakuwan kemazu. pikiruwan ku mukuwa.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: muvakavakar na sakura i naniyam zekalr zi salaw vulay. nu muvakar na sakura mu, alamu lra.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: ngangara ta nu kaseveran lra. kapuwari lra.
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: kemazu mu, alamu lra nu ’Amiyan lra.
S.TRANSL: Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: ai mu. salaw ku talrima.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: kiumalr ku ziya, man veliyas u muruma’ i zekalr?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: vaveliyas ku mukuwa patakesiya.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: man ’azi u muwai patakesi i tokay?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: ’alra na sare’ez ku kanangku zekalr, zi mianger ku pavales kanangku zekalr.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: sayhu u temenun, i eman na panadam kannu?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: i imulri na vavayan. marasayhuihu temenun i intaw i kaniyam zekalr.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: man mianger u menadam temenun?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: a temenun mu, nanta kakuwayanan. maranger ku patrungutrungulr za nanta kakuwayanan.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: pamelri tavu’ i ini na temuwakutra kana dawa.
mau i inku na temuwakutra.
sayhu u awa! kasawariyan ta temuwakutra kanini?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: amanan, karuwa a saya liyusan. ta ta’uraw ziya na ziketran zi na veras zi, puwayay za pikak pukasayaw tremiyur. maruwa ta avakanay kana dalilr lra.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: ulra a eman nu naniwanan?
ulra a kamangulr zi a kenaw i kaninku. ningku sinaleman peniya!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蔥，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and spring onion, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: manueman paisu nu tremima’ ta kanini na zuwaya.
a zuwa leman lima pulu’ paisu peniya.
sahar ku kanini na kiping, manueman paisu?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: a lima leman i ini.
pazangal lra, ’azi maruwa pulusu za saema?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: ’azi maruwa, kasipun ku nu ku pulusuwaw.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: ai, nu kemazu mu, verayay ku za saya a kiping na ’uze’uzem.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: aelak ku kanini na kamutr zi na siuy.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: a zuwa kuzulr paisu peniya. dinawayan kanangku lima i ini, kasawariyan zi ’azi kakuwatreng.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: ku palrazamaw ku ’ali’an mu, karuwa pulusu ziya za saema?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: ai mu, ku lehetranay kannu za zuwa pulu’ pasēnto.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: alamu mena’uwa! menaniwan mi za kiping zi za talupung.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: manueman paisu na kiping?
na kiping a saya mu, telu leman lima pulu’ paisu, a teluwa mu sa kuzulr.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: tremima’ ku za saya, verayay ku kana vekal.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: ’inavayan. maranger ku tremima’ za kinaveras zi za ’alum na milramumu.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: uniyan lra na maderu. ulra ziya na ’avay na mitana’. tratrima’ u?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: ai, verayay ku za saya. tremima’ ku za maderu nu masalr lra.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: ai, ku avakanay kannu na ’avay za luvuk.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
